column9: (Pretty hard, precise and therefore inconsistent, you need to slightly walk forward before doing the F-air if they DI away.)
(You need to land pretty low to the ground, you’re only +5 so otherwise just go for Jabs.)
Pretty tough as you need to fastfall the second F-air without buffer and the first F-air needs to be spaced properly. Is worth the damage though.
Most optimal/consistent way of dealing damage at 0% As long as the first F-air doesn't put the opponent in tumble this will work.
Getting the fastfall requires some practice.

Combo Starter: SH N-air (fastfall between the 3rd and 4th hit)
column9: Getting the fastfall requires some practice, Only do 2 N-airs on lighter character, on heavies do 4.
This took me 5 minutes of trying, this is really really hard, you’re better off doing DA
Can also be done at 0% and from a neutral jump but it’s a LOT harder.
Works at 35% for mario and slightly up, requires frame perfect FH Up-air. Pretty difficult but high reward
You can get a third up-air against bigger characters
The first DJC Z-air needs to be on the spot.
B-air works at higher % than Up-air and has more hitstun making combos easier. Combo’s with U-air usually deal 1.5 damage less
Works really well if they DI-away. Kill set-up for a spike
Depending on % you have to do a FH or SH D-air.
Doesn’t work on fastfallers, SH up-air is easier does 2.1 damage less.
Should be used if they DI up-air away.
Works better at around 35-45%
For a more detailed explanation click here
I don’t care that it’s not optimal it’s cool and guaranteed.
Only works when the Z-air hits high enough.
Character dependent, you need to buffer SH F-air and instantly drift back to get the sweet spot.
Character dependent easier on fastfallers
Kill confirm, you can do any other aerial, but it’s kinda pointless.
Will remove any will the opponent has to continue playing. Kill confirm.
Must be angled upwards!
Works better at 155% or higher, kill confirm
Kills Mario at 140% on all stages
